item.title: Creative Problem Solving through Teamwork
item.description: Imaginons et créons des solutions liées à l’environnement ! Groups of 5 to 7 students create and then present an original performance about exploring the ocean and solving a real life water problem.

item.title: Real Life Water Problems
item.description: In order to set the stage for the children to become more aware of the real life water porblems there were a series of lessons planned. Together we read, enacted and responded to a story that highlighted the myraid of ways in which we pollute water.

item.title: Aqua Vitae: Uneven Distribution
item.description: A race for water where you are disadvantaged because of your tools. Of course it is not fair…just like the uneven distribution and access to fresh water supplies on this planet!

item.title: 100 cups: precious fresh water
item.description: Even though our planet is called the blue planet, fresh water is a scarce resource.

item.title: Let's combine our ideas
item.description: Team members shared their machine designs and explored possible solutions. They questioned each other and took time to listen attentively to weigh options and feedback each other.In the end this team decided to retain the strong points of each design and COMBINE them into one big idea.

item.title: Collaborative Learning : Group Work
item.description: Group work in action Learning to learn together and from each other is at the heart of global competencies that prepare the children for 21st century work world. Students learn to work on the same side, side by side to have a more engaging and successful learning experience. They can be seen encouraging, guiding, and working on each otherï¿½s strengths, getting frustrated, overcoming frustrations, getting into conflicts and resolving them too.

item.title: Blogging is Fun and Worthwhile
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.
